{
    "number": 192614,
    "data": "1,3,7,11,23,31,47,71,103,127,151,167,191,263,311,383,431,503,631,647,743,863,887,911,967,983,1103,1151,1303,1487,1583,1607,1783,1823,1831,1847,1871,2087,2207,2311,2351,2423,2447,2543,2591,2687,2927,3023",
    "name": "Monotonic ordering of set S generated by these rules:  if x and y are in S and 2x+y^2 is a prime, then 2x+y^2 is in S, and 1 is in S.",
    "comment": [
        "See the discussions at A192476 and A192580."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "start = {1}; primes = Table[Prime[n], {n, 1, 1000}];",
        "f[x_, y_] := If[MemberQ[primes, 2 x + y^2], 2 x + y^2]",
        "b[x_] :=",
        "  Block[{w = x},",
        "   Select[Union[",
        "     Flatten[AppendTo[w,",
        "       Table[f[w[[i]], w[[j]]], {i, 1, Length[w]}, {j, 1,",
        "         Length[w]}]]]], # < 4000 &]];",
        "t = FixedPoint[b, start]  (* A192614 *)",
        "PrimePi[t]   (* A192615 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A192476, A192580, A192615."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 05 2011",
    "references": 2,
    "revision": 4,
    "time": "2012-03-30T18:57:36-04:00",
    "created": "2011-07-06T13:18:44-04:00"
}
